title: Part A
stimulusHtml: Select a point value to view scoring criteria, solutions, and/or examples and to score the response.
descriptions: The response does not state that at 8 units the firm’s economic profit is negative (economic loss) and/or does not explain that the price is below the ATC.
The response states that at 8 units the firm’s economic profit is negative (economic loss) and explains that the price is below the ATC.

title: Part B
stimulusHtml: Select a point value to view scoring criteria, solutions, and/or examples and to score the response.
descriptions: The response does not state that the firm should decrease its price and/or does not explain that when demand is elastic (the portion of the demand curve where marginal revenue is greater than zero), a lower price leads to more total revenue, or at $15 the firm produces the quantity where marginal revenue is zero and total revenue is maximized.

The response states that the firm should decrease its price and explains that when demand is elastic (the portion of the demand curve where marginal revenue is greater than zero), a lower price leads to more total revenue, or at $15 the firm produces the quantity where marginal revenue is zero and total revenue is maximized.

title: Part C
stimulusHtml: Select a point value to view scoring criteria, solutions, and/or examples and to score the response.
descriptions: The response does not state that deadweight loss increases and/or does not explain that the firm produces farther away from the allocatively efficient quantity, where marginal cost equals price.
The response states that deadweight loss increases and explains that the firm produces farther away from the allocatively efficient quantity, where marginal cost equals price.

title: Part D
stimulusHtml: Select a point value to view scoring criteria, solutions, and/or examples and to score the response.
descriptions:
The response does none of the following:

· Identifies that the firm’s profit-maximizing quantity is 6 units and explains that at that quantity marginal revenue is equal to marginal cost.

· Identifies that the firm’s profit-maximizing price is $21 and explains that it is the price on the demand curve at the profit-maximizing quantity (where marginal revenue is equal to marginal cost).

The response does both of the following:

· Identifies that the firm’s profit-maximizing quantity is 6 units and explains that at that quantity marginal revenue is equal to marginal cost.

· Identifies that the firm’s profit-maximizing price is $21 and explains that it is the price on the demand curve at the profit-maximizing quantity (where marginal revenue is equal to marginal cost).

title: Part E
stimulusHtml: Select a point value to view scoring criteria, solutions, and/or examples and to score the response.
descriptions:
The response does not calculate the total cost as $162 and/or does not show the work.

Total Cost = Average Total Cost ×Quantity = $27 ×6=$162 MathType@MTEF@5@5@@664F@

The response calculates total cost as $162 and shows the work.

Total Cost = Average Total Cost ×Quantity = $27 ×6=$162 MathType@MTEF@5@5@@664F@
